comments:
Overview:
---------
    When launching a unit test either in run mode or debug mode (mostly debug
mode) I get the following error message:
    An internal error occurred during: "Launching".

Steps to reproduce:
-------------------
    1. Create a junit unit test for a source java file
    2. Set one or more breakpoints in the test file
    3. Make sure your compiler and debug settings are restored to default
    4. Also make sure you are using java 5.0
    5. Now, right clilck on the test file; on the menu that pops up go to "Debug
As...". This brings a sub menu, choose JUnit-Test
    6. Mine is set to change to Debug perspective (hopefully this should not
matter since the error happens prior to switching perspective)

Actual Result:
--------------
    I get "An internal error occurred during: "Launching". When refering to the
error log (using Window > show view > Error Log > double click on the error
item), the stack trace is:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError:
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.DebugCoreMessages.getString(Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/lang/String;
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.existsProblems(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:433)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.finalLaunchCheck(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:220)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:578)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:733)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:931)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

Expected Results:
-----------------
    The test should launch and execution should suspend at the breakpoint
waiting for user action

Build Date and Platform:
------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20050627-1435
java.version=1.5.0_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -clean -data c:\apps\modules

Created an attachment (id=24402)
Error log from current session

Here is the eclipse launch command line parameters:
C:\eclipse\eclipse.exe -clean -data c:\apps\modules -vm
C:\jdk1.5.0_03\jre\bin\javaw -vmargs -Xmx384M
-Djava.endorsed.dirs=C:\tools\jboss-4.0.2\lib\endorsed

I believe you have the wrong version of the org.eclipse.jdt.junit plug-in in 
your SDK installation. The line numbers in the given stack trace do not match 
those that are in the 3.1 release (there are only 212 lines in the 
JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java file that exists in 3.1).

I am not sure how that happened since, I removed the previous installation of
eclipse and reinstalled it on to a fresh directory. More over the weird part is,
it works for the firt couple of times and then starts creating problems. In any
case, since you pointed out the problem, can you please suggest how I can
replace with the right version of that plugin?

I would suggest to create a clean installation from the 3.1 download. Then 
start your workspace with the "-clean" option.

Please refer to my command line parameters, I already use "-clean" option and as
I mentioned earlier it was on a clean install I had this problem. It is possible
there was some residual information that got transferred thru' the workspace
because for both the (new and old) installations I used the same workspace and
effectively the same the .metadata directory. I was trying to find if there was
an alternate way of just taking care of the junit part. Thanks anyway.
